recipes.title: Gluten-Free Brûléed Brie Crostini with Fig Jam & Thyme
recipes.description: Caramelized brie on crispy gluten-free crostini with sweet fig jam and fresh thyme - elegant and irresistible.
recipes.longDescription: These gluten-free brûléed brie crostini combine creamy melted brie with a perfectly caramelized sugar crust, paired with sweet fig jam and aromatic fresh thyme. The contrast between the crispy gluten-free bread, warm gooey cheese, and fruity jam creates a sophisticated appetizer that's perfect for entertaining. The torched sugar adds a delightful crunch and elegant presentation.
ingredients: 1 gluten-free baguette, sliced into 1/2-inch rounds (12 pieces)
8 oz brie cheese, cut into 12 equal slices
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Brush each gluten-free bread slice with olive oil on both sides and arrange on the baking sheet.
Toast the bread in the oven for 5-7 minutes until golden and crispy. Remove and let cool slightly.
Place one slice of brie on each toasted crostini.
Sprinkle 1/4 teaspoon of granulated sugar evenly over each brie slice.
Using a kitchen torch, carefully caramelize the sugar on each brie slice until golden and bubbly. If no torch is available, place under the broiler for 1-2 minutes, watching carefully.
Immediately top each brûléed brie crostini with 1 teaspoon of fig jam.
Garnish with fresh thyme leaves, a light sprinkle of sea salt, and cracked black pepper.
Drizzle with honey and serve immediately while the cheese is warm and gooey.
recipes.tips: For the best results, use a kitchen torch for even caramelization. If using the broiler, watch very carefully as the sugar can burn quickly. Make sure your gluten-free bread is completely crispy before adding toppings - soggy crostini won't hold up well.
variations: Substitute apricot or cherry preserves for the fig jam
Add a thin slice of prosciutto before the brie
Use fresh rosemary instead of thyme
Top with crushed pistachios for added crunch

recipes.seoDescription: Elegant gluten-free brûléed brie crostini with caramelized sugar, sweet fig jam, and fresh thyme. Perfect party appetizer with crispy bread and gooey melted cheese.

recipes.title: Gluten-Free Brûléed Brie Crostini with Cranberry & Rosemary
recipes.description: Torched brie topped with tart cranberry compote and aromatic rosemary - festive and delicious.
recipes.longDescription: These festive gluten-free brûléed brie crostini feature caramelized brie topped with homemade cranberry compote and fresh rosemary. The tart-sweet cranberries beautifully complement the rich, creamy brie, while the caramelized sugar crust adds a sophisticated crunch. Perfect for holiday entertaining or special occasions, these crostini are both visually stunning and incredibly flavorful.
instructions: Make cranberry compote: In a small saucepan, combine cranberries, orange juice, and honey. Simmer over medium heat for 8-10 minutes until cranberries burst and mixture thickens. Let cool.
Preheat oven to 375°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Brush gluten-free bread slices with olive oil and toast in oven for 5-7 minutes until crispy and golden.
Remove from oven and place one slice of brie on each crostini.
Evenly sprinkle 1/4 teaspoon sugar over each brie slice.
Using a kitchen torch, caramelize the sugar until golden and bubbling.
Top each brûléed brie with 1 tablespoon of cranberry compote.
Garnish with fresh rosemary, orange zest, and a pinch of sea salt.
Serve immediately while warm and the brie is soft and melty.
recipes.tips: The cranberry compote can be made up to 3 days in advance and stored in the refrigerator. Bring to room temperature before using. For a deeper flavor, add a splash of balsamic vinegar to the compote.
variations: Add chopped pecans to the cranberry compote
Use dried cranberries rehydrated in orange juice
Substitute thyme for rosemary
Add a drizzle of balsamic reduction
recipes.seoTitle: Gluten-Free Brûléed Brie Crostini with Cranberry & Rosemary | Unglued Food
recipes.seoDescription: Festive gluten-free brûléed brie crostini with tart cranberry compote and fresh rosemary. Perfect holiday appetizer with caramelized cheese and homemade cranberry topping.

recipes.title: Gluten-Free Brûléed Brie Crostini with Honey & Walnuts
recipes.description: Sweet caramelized brie drizzled with honey and topped with crunchy candied walnuts - simple perfection.
recipes.longDescription: These gluten-free brûléed brie crostini showcase the classic combination of honey and walnuts with rich, caramelized brie. The torched sugar creates a delicate crackly crust, while the honey adds natural sweetness and the candied walnuts provide satisfying crunch. Simple yet sophisticated, this appetizer is perfect for those who appreciate elegant flavor combinations.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons honey, plus extra for drizzling
instructions: Make candied walnuts: Melt butter in a small pan, add walnuts and 1 tablespoon honey. Cook for 3-4 minutes until walnuts are toasted and caramelized. Set aside.
Preheat oven to 375°F and prepare a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Brush gluten-free bread slices with olive oil and toast for 5-7 minutes until crispy.
Top each toasted crostini with a slice of brie.
Sprinkle 1/4 teaspoon of sugar evenly over each brie slice.
Use a kitchen torch to caramelize the sugar until golden and bubbly.
Immediately top each brûléed brie with candied walnuts.
Drizzle with additional honey and sprinkle with sea salt.
Garnish with fresh thyme if desired and serve warm.
recipes.tips: Toast the walnuts just before serving for maximum crunch. If you don't have a kitchen torch, you can use the broiler, but watch very carefully to prevent burning. The candied walnuts can be made ahead and stored in an airtight container for up to 3 days.
variations: Use pecans instead of walnuts
Add a drizzle of truffle honey for luxury
Top with fresh figs in season
Sprinkle with fresh thyme or rosemary
recipes.seoTitle: Gluten-Free Brûléed Brie Crostini with Honey & Walnuts | Unglued Food
recipes.seoDescription: Simple and elegant gluten-free brûléed brie crostini with honey drizzle and candied walnuts. Perfect appetizer with caramelized cheese and crunchy nuts.

recipes.title: Gluten-Free Brûléed Brie Crostini with Apple & Cinnamon
recipes.description: Caramelized brie with sautéed cinnamon apples - a warm, comforting appetizer perfect for fall.
recipes.longDescription: These gluten-free brûléed brie crostini feature caramelized brie topped with tender cinnamon-spiced apples. The combination of sweet, warm apples with rich, melty brie and a caramelized sugar crust creates a comforting appetizer that's perfect for autumn entertaining. The hint of cinnamon adds warmth without overwhelming the delicate brie flavor.
ingredients: 2 medium apples (Honeycrisp or Granny Smith), diced small
instructions: Prepare cinnamon apples: Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add diced apples, brown sugar, and cinnamon. Sauté for 5-7 minutes until apples are tender but not mushy. Set aside.
Preheat oven to 375°F. Line baking sheet with parchment paper.
Brush gluten-free bread slices with olive oil and toast for 5-7 minutes until golden and crispy.
Place a slice of brie on each toasted crostini.
Sprinkle 1/4 teaspoon granulated sugar evenly over each brie slice.
Torch the sugar using a kitchen torch until golden and caramelized.
Top each brûléed brie with a generous spoonful of warm cinnamon apples.
Garnish with a small fresh sage leaf and a tiny pinch of sea salt.
Serve immediately while the apples are warm and the brie is melted.
recipes.tips: Choose firm apples that hold their shape when cooked - Honeycrisp and Granny Smith work perfectly. The apples can be prepared ahead and gently reheated before serving. For extra richness, add a splash of heavy cream to the apples while cooking.
variations: Add a drizzle of caramel sauce
Mix in chopped pecans with the apples
Use pears instead of apples
Add a pinch of nutmeg to the cinnamon
recipes.seoTitle: Gluten-Free Brûléed Brie Crostini with Apple & Cinnamon | Unglued Food
recipes.seoDescription: Warm and comforting gluten-free brûléed brie crostini with sautéed cinnamon apples. Perfect fall appetizer with caramelized cheese and spiced fruit topping.

recipes.title: Gluten-Free Brûléed Brie Crostini with Prosciutto & Balsamic
recipes.description: Savory brûléed brie with crispy prosciutto and tangy balsamic glaze - sophisticated and indulgent.
recipes.longDescription: These gluten-free brûléed brie crostini combine the richness of caramelized brie with salty, crispy prosciutto and a tangy balsamic reduction. The contrast between sweet caramelized sugar, savory meat, and acidic balsamic creates a complex flavor profile that's perfect for sophisticated entertaining. Each bite delivers layers of texture and taste.
instructions: Make balsamic reduction: In a small saucepan, combine balsamic vinegar and honey. Simmer over medium-low heat for 10-12 minutes until reduced by half and syrupy. Set aside to cool.
Preheat oven to 400°F. Place prosciutto on a baking sheet and bake for 8-10 minutes until crispy. Set aside.
Reduce oven to 375°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Brush gluten-free bread slices with olive oil and toast for 5-7 minutes until crispy.
Top each crostini with a slice of brie.
Sprinkle 1/4 teaspoon sugar over each brie slice and torch until caramelized.
Top each brûléed brie with crispy prosciutto pieces.
Drizzle with balsamic reduction and top with fresh arugula.
Finish with cracked black pepper and flaky sea salt. Serve immediately.
recipes.tips: The balsamic reduction can be made several days ahead and stored in the refrigerator. Warm slightly before serving for easier drizzling. Crisp the prosciutto until it's crunchy but not burnt for the best texture contrast.
variations: Add sliced fresh figs when in season
Use crispy bacon instead of prosciutto
Top with caramelized onions
Add a few pine nuts for extra crunch
recipes.seoTitle: Gluten-Free Brûléed Brie Crostini with Prosciutto & Balsamic | Unglued Food
recipes.seoDescription: Sophisticated gluten-free brûléed brie crostini with crispy prosciutto and balsamic reduction. Elegant appetizer with caramelized cheese and savory-sweet toppings.

recipes.title: Gluten-Free Brûléed Brie Crostini with Pear & Gorgonzola
recipes.description: Elegant brûléed brie with sweet pear and tangy gorgonzola - a luxurious flavor combination.
recipes.longDescription: These gluten-free brûléed brie crostini feature a sophisticated combination of caramelized brie, sweet sautéed pears, and tangy gorgonzola crumbles. The interplay between sweet pear, mild brie, and bold gorgonzola creates a complex, restaurant-quality appetizer. The caramelized sugar crust adds elegance and textural interest to every bite.
instructions: Sauté pears: Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add diced pears and honey. Cook for 5-6 minutes until pears are tender and slightly caramelized. Set aside.
Preheat oven to 375°F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Brush gluten-free bread slices with olive oil and toast for 5-7 minutes until golden and crisp.
Place a slice of brie on each toasted crostini.
Evenly sprinkle 1/4 teaspoon sugar over each brie slice.
Using a kitchen torch, caramelize the sugar until golden and bubbling.
Top each brûléed brie with sautéed pears.
Sprinkle crumbled gorgonzola over the pears.
Garnish with fresh basil, sea salt, and cracked pepper. Serve warm.
recipes.tips: Choose ripe but firm pears - Bartlett or Bosc work beautifully. The pears should be tender but still hold their shape. If you're not a fan of strong blue cheese, use a milder gorgonzola dolce or reduce the amount.
variations: Substitute goat cheese for gorgonzola for milder flavor
Add candied walnuts for extra crunch
Drizzle with truffle honey
Use fresh thyme instead of basil
recipes.seoTitle: Gluten-Free Brûléed Brie Crostini with Pear & Gorgonzola | Unglued Food
recipes.seoDescription: Luxurious gluten-free brûléed brie crostini with sweet sautéed pear and tangy gorgonzola. Gourmet appetizer with complex flavors and caramelized cheese.

recipes.title: Gluten-Free Brûléed Brie Crostini with Blackberry & Mint
recipes.description: Fresh brûléed brie topped with blackberry compote and bright mint - vibrant and refreshing.
recipes.longDescription: These gluten-free brûléed brie crostini showcase the beautiful pairing of caramelized brie with fresh blackberry compote and aromatic mint. The tart-sweet blackberries provide a burst of fruit flavor, while the mint adds a refreshing note that balances the richness of the cheese. Perfect for summer entertaining, these crostini are both visually stunning and deliciously unique.
instructions: Make blackberry compote: In a small saucepan, combine blackberries, honey, and lemon juice. Simmer for 8-10 minutes, gently mashing berries, until mixture thickens. Let cool slightly.
Preheat oven to 375°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Brush gluten-free bread slices with olive oil and toast for 5-7 minutes until crispy and golden.
Top each crostini with a slice of brie.
Sprinkle 1/4 teaspoon sugar evenly over each brie slice.
Torch the sugar with a kitchen torch until caramelized and golden.
Spoon blackberry compote generously over each brûléed brie.
Top with fresh mint chiffonade and a sprinkle of lemon zest.
Add a tiny pinch of sea salt and serve immediately while warm.
recipes.tips: The blackberry compote can be made up to 3 days ahead. Fresh blackberries work best, but frozen can be used in a pinch - just thaw and drain excess liquid first. For a more intense mint flavor, steep a few mint leaves in the compote while it cools.
variations: Substitute raspberries or blueberries
Add a drizzle of balsamic reduction
Use fresh basil instead of mint
Top with toasted pistachios
recipes.seoTitle: Gluten-Free Brûléed Brie Crostini with Blackberry & Mint | Unglued Food
recipes.seoDescription: Vibrant gluten-free brûléed brie crostini with fresh blackberry compote and mint. Perfect summer appetizer with caramelized cheese and fruity topping.

recipes.title: Gluten-Free Brûléed Brie Crostini with Caramelized Onion & Bacon
recipes.description: Savory brûléed brie with sweet caramelized onions and crispy bacon - rich and satisfying.
recipes.longDescription: These gluten-free brûléed brie crostini combine the ultimate savory toppings: sweet caramelized onions and crispy bacon with rich, caramelized brie. The deeply flavored onions add complexity and sweetness, while the bacon provides salty crunch. This is a hearty, indulgent appetizer that's perfect for those who love bold, savory flavors.
ingredients: 6 strips bacon, cooked crispy and crumbled
instructions: Caramelize onions: Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-low heat. Add sliced onions and brown sugar. Cook slowly for 25-30 minutes, stirring occasionally, until onions are deep golden brown and sweet. Set aside.
Cook bacon until crispy, then crumble. Set aside.
Preheat oven to 375°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Brush gluten-free bread slices with olive oil and toast for 5-7 minutes until crispy.
Place a slice of brie on each toasted crostini.
Sprinkle 1/4 teaspoon sugar over each brie slice and torch until caramelized.
Top each brûléed brie with caramelized onions.
Sprinkle crumbled bacon over the onions.
Garnish with fresh chives, sea salt, and cracked pepper. Serve warm.
recipes.tips: Don't rush the onion caramelization - low and slow is the key to developing deep, sweet flavor. The caramelized onions can be made up to 3 days ahead and stored in the refrigerator. For a smoky twist, use applewood smoked bacon.
variations: Add a drizzle of balsamic reduction
Use pancetta instead of bacon
Top with fresh thyme
Add blue cheese crumbles for extra punch
recipes.seoTitle: Gluten-Free Brûléed Brie Crostini with Caramelized Onion & Bacon | Unglued Food
recipes.seoDescription: Rich gluten-free brûléed brie crostini with sweet caramelized onions and crispy bacon. Indulgent savory appetizer with caramelized cheese and bold toppings.

recipes.title: Gluten-Free Brûléed Brie Crostini with Pomegranate & Pistachio
recipes.description: Elegant brûléed brie with jewel-like pomegranate arils and crunchy pistachios - festive and beautiful.
recipes.longDescription: These gluten-free brûléed brie crostini are a visual masterpiece featuring caramelized brie topped with ruby-red pomegranate arils and vibrant green pistachios. The tart-sweet pomegranate bursts provide refreshing contrast to the rich brie, while the pistachios add luxurious crunch. Perfect for holiday entertaining, these crostini are as beautiful as they are delicious.
instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Brush gluten-free bread slices with olive oil and toast for 5-7 minutes until golden and crispy.
Place a slice of brie on each toasted crostini.
Sprinkle 1/4 teaspoon sugar evenly over each brie slice.
Use a kitchen torch to caramelize the sugar until golden and bubbly.
Immediately top each brûléed brie with pomegranate arils.
Sprinkle chopped pistachios over the pomegranate.
Drizzle with honey and optional pomegranate molasses.
Garnish with fresh mint and a pinch of sea salt. Serve immediately.
recipes.tips: To easily remove pomegranate arils, cut the fruit in half and tap the back with a wooden spoon over a bowl. Toast the pistachios briefly in a dry pan for enhanced flavor. These crostini are best assembled just before serving to keep the bread crispy.
variations: Add crumbled goat cheese alongside the brie
Use toasted almonds instead of pistachios
Top with fresh basil instead of mint
Add a drizzle of balsamic reduction
recipes.seoTitle: Gluten-Free Brûléed Brie Crostini with Pomegranate & Pistachio | Unglued Food
recipes.seoDescription: Stunning gluten-free brûléed brie crostini with pomegranate arils and pistachios. Festive holiday appetizer with caramelized cheese and jewel-like toppings.

recipes.title: Gluten-Free Brûléed Brie Crostini with Peach & Basil
recipes.description: Summer-fresh brûléed brie with juicy peaches and aromatic basil - light and flavorful.
recipes.longDescription: These gluten-free brûléed brie crostini celebrate peak summer produce with ripe, juicy peaches and fresh basil paired with caramelized brie. The sweet peaches provide bursts of fruity flavor, while the basil adds an herbaceous note that perfectly complements the rich cheese. Light, fresh, and elegant, these crostini are ideal for warm-weather entertaining.
instructions: Prepare peaches: In a small bowl, toss diced peaches with honey and lemon juice. Let macerate for 10 minutes.
Preheat oven to 375°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Brush gluten-free bread slices with olive oil and toast for 5-7 minutes until crispy and golden.
Place a slice of brie on each toasted crostini.
Evenly sprinkle 1/4 teaspoon sugar over each brie slice.
Torch the sugar using a kitchen torch until caramelized and golden.
Top each brûléed brie with macerated peaches, draining excess liquid.
Garnish generously with fresh basil chiffonade.
Add a pinch of sea salt and cracked pepper. Serve immediately.
recipes.tips: Use perfectly ripe peaches for the best flavor - they should be fragrant and slightly soft to the touch. If peaches aren't in season, use high-quality frozen peaches, thawed and drained well. The peaches can be prepared a few hours ahead and kept refrigerated.
variations: Substitute nectarines for peaches
Add a drizzle of balsamic reduction
Use fresh mint instead of basil
Top with toasted almonds or pine nuts
recipes.seoTitle: Gluten-Free Brûléed Brie Crostini with Peach & Basil | Unglued Food
recipes.seoDescription: Fresh gluten-free brûléed brie crostini with ripe peaches and basil. Perfect summer appetizer with caramelized cheese and juicy fruit topping.
